channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Tan Duc Mai

item.title: Credit Card Validator
item.description: → Go to GitHub Introduction Chances are you have a credit card in your wallet or purse. Credit card numbers have a ‘checksum’ built into them, a mathematical relationship between at least one number and the others. The checksum enables a computer to detect typos, if not fraudulent numbers, without having to query a database (which can be slow). Most cards use an algorithm invented by Hans Peter Luhn, a scientist who worked for IBM.

item.title: Petals Around The Rose
item.description: → Go to GitHub Introduction The the game is Petals Around the Rose and the name of the game is important. The computer will roll five dice and ask the user to guess the score for the roll. The score will always be an even number (including zero). The user’s mission is to work out how the computer calculates the score in order to become a Potentate of the Rose.
